results.title: X-Men [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Singer, Lauren Shuler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The concentration camps of World War 2 is an unlikely place to start this faithful film adaptation of the long running Marvel comic series. Director Bryan Singer however quickly makes the connection apparent as this tale of difference and intolerance unfolds. Set mainly in an unspecified future, ‘X-Men’ sets up the premise that human evolution has taken un unexpected leap when various children are born with a gene that mutates into extraodinary super powers. These special beings however are met with suspicion and fear by the wider community, in particular by right wing Senator Robert Kelly (Bruce Davison), who wants to register the much maligned ‘mutants’. Singer carefully introduces us into the labyrinth world of the X-men by following the plight of shy teenager, Marie D’Acanto (Anna Paquin), who discovers, much to her horror, that she has the power to absorb the life out of anyone she touches. Through her we meet Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), a dangerous loner who, when provoked, protrudes steel blades out of his knuckles, as well as meeting the rest of the X-men who reside in a special school set up by the wheel chair bound and telepathic Professor Xavier (Patrick Stewart). Of course every super hero must have it’s villain, and a powerful foe is created in the mysterious and tormented Magnetto (Ian McKellen), a mutant who has the ability to harness magnetic energy and wants to start a war between the intolerant humans and the mutants. Cast also includes Halle Berry, Famke Janssen, James Marsden, Rebecca Romjin-Stamos and Ray Park.

results.title: Chopper [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Michele Bennett and Palace Films
results.brief_description: This AFI award winning film is based on the life of Mark Brandon - “Chopper” - Read, a notorious Australian criminal who became a best selling author, publishing 9 books of his life and times as a key stand man in Melbourne’s underworld. Eric Bana plays Chopper following his conviction for abducting a judge who was proceeding over the case of his best friend, Jimmy Loughnan (Simon Lyndon). Read ends up serving a 16 year sentence for his efforts, during which he shares a cell with Jimmy and has to contend with Keithy George (David Field), a crime boss who runs the prison. After an attack of violence instigated by Chopper, he kills Keithy and finds himself the target of numerous prisoners wishing revenge on him. As he sees it, the only way to escape the notorious H division is to get his friend to chop his ears off so that he can be transferred to another prison. Eight years later, Chopper is released and finds himself battling his own personal demons and psychotic episodes to try and adjust to outside life. All he can focus on is seeking revenge on arch enemy Neville Bartos (Vince Colosimo) and looking out for his girlfriend, Tanya (Kate Beahan). This special edition includes deleted scenes, theatrical trailer and footage of director Andrew Dominik and Eric Bana’s visit to Chopper in Tasmania while researching the film.

results.title: Code unknown: incomplete tales of several journeys
results.creator_credit: Michael Haneke, Alain Sarde, Marin Karmitz, France 2 Cinema, Filmex and Bavaria Film
results.brief_description: On a busy street on St Germain des Pres in Paris, an actress on her way to an audition is confronted by her partner’s brother who has run away from the family farm and wishes to stay at her apartment. She gives him the code for entry but warns him that when his brother Georges returns from taking war photographs in Kosovo, he will have to leave. In anger the youth throws litter onto the lap of a Romanian beggar and is then confronted by an outraged African immigrant who demands he makes an apology to the woman. Filmed in a breathtaking nine minute long take, this initial scene becomes the frame around which “Code Unknown” interrogates the alienation and breakdown in social relations affecting the western world. From this initially confronting opening, the film becomes a sequence of scenes in which the traditional linear narrative structure of film is replaced with moments and fragments of disparate lives: the Romanian woman is deported back to her homeland only to begin again her attempt to illegally cross the border; the actress and the photographer passionately invest in their art and work meaning and purpose which is absent from their relationship; members of an immigrant Mali family attempt to negotiate the consequences on their culture and family of a move to France; a farmer is left alone on his farm as one by one his children refuse to carry on his work. Haneke’s films have often been accused of didactism and moralism (often by a defensive critical film culture which has abandoned political and metaphysical engagement for the laissez-faire aesthetics of denuded postmodernism), but as this film makes clear his commitment is to a critical and intellectually rigorous cinema which utilises modernist techniques to essay the state of contemporary social relations in Europe. His assured and daring mise-en-scene asks the viewer to “decipher” not only the film’s own structure but to also ask questions of what are the ethical and political codes now governing the cultures of the new post-Cold War capitalist world. “Code Unknown” suggest that this deciphering is difficult but crucial if we are to make sense of the dangers and tensions of a paradoxically multi-ethnic but highly socially segregated contemporary world. Though undeniably bleak, by refusing the pessimistic lure of nihilism, Haneke’s film legitimates the radical potential of film at the end of the century. With Juliet Binoche, Thierry Neuvic.

results.title: 'M' [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Seymour Nebenzal and Nero-Film
results.brief_description: Peter Lorre in his greatest role portrays a psychotic child molester - a pathetic vagabond figure who experiences a frenzy at the sight of tender young school girls, and try as he may, he is unable to control the fervour of his criminal inclinations. The police disregard his letters of confession to them as the work of a lunatic, leaving the underworld to take the law into their own hands. The stylised realism of the sets and the detachment with which the opposing forces of law and outlawry are portrayed place this now classic film within the ambit of the so-called ‘new objectivity’ which was a reaction in Germany to the expressionist movement. This version is the longest available.

results.title: The Ninth gate
results.brief_description: Legendary director Roman Polanski subtly intertwines his trademark themes of gothic, supernatural excess with hints of suspense and humour to deliver a provocative and atmospheric screen adaptation of Arturo Perez Reverte’s 1993 best-selling novel, “El Club Dumas”. Unscrupulous rare book broker Dean Corso gets more than he has bargained for after he is hired by multimillionaire Boris Balkan to authenticate a volume of The Nine Gates of the Kingdom of Shadows, a priceless seventeenth century occult text whose woodcut images, when assembled correctly, are rumoured to have the power to summon the Devil. Dispatched to Europe to hunt down the only two other copies known to exist, Corso soon finds himself enmeshed in a mystery of epic proportions as he follows a trail of clues, encounters eccentric bibliophiles, is relentlessly pursued by a widening circle of deadly foes and is rescued by an enigmatic and ubiquitous green-eyed beauty. As the people he has been dealing with in relation to the book begin to die under bizarre circumstances, Corso must locate the missing images, both to save his own skin and to resolve his own growing obsession with the arcane legend of the book. Stars Johnny Depp as Corso, Frank Langella as Boris Balkan, Lena Olin as Liana Telfer, and Emmanuelle Seigner as The Girl.

results.title: Gidget goes to Rome
results.creator_credit: Paul Wendkos, Jerry Bresler and Jerry Bresler Productions
results.brief_description: Gidget Goes to Rome is the third film to be made inspired by the sun-happy and beach-loving characters created by Frederick Kohner in the mid 50s. In this film, Francie “Gidget” Lawrence goes to Italy with her boyfriend, Moondoggie, and their friends for a whirlwind tour of Rome. Although chaperoned by Aunt Albertina, the two aren’t stopped from experiencing brief extracurricular flirtations. Cast includes: Cindy Carol, James Darren, Jesse Royce Landis, Cesare Danova, Danielle de Metz and Joby Baker.

results.title: Regarding Henry
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Scott Rudin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford stars as Henry Turner, a successful but ruthless New York lawyer who must win at any cost, even at the expense of his family. A single, freakish gunshot brings Henry’s world crashing down as he is left incapacitated and with no memory of the life he used to lead. Now, faced with starting over, Henry will learn the painful truth about his life and rediscover the family he never really had. Also starring Annette Bening as Henry’s long-suffering wife, this thought provoking film questions the importance of money over family and ultimately - the price of happiness.

results.title: Election
results.creator_credit: Alexander Payne, Keith Samples, David Gale, Ron Yerxa, Albert Berger, Bona Fide Productions, MTV Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Matthew Broderick plays Jim McAllister, a popular and well respected teacher at George Washington Carver High School. Reese Witherspoon is Tracy Flick, A-Grade student and No. 1 candidate for the student body president. Tracy is confident that her campaign for presidency is going smoothly until Mr McAllister decides to disrupt proceedings and introduce opposition to her as yet unchallenged ride to the top. More than a teenage flick, director Alexander Payne has satirized the popular genre to investigate notions of political and moral corruption. In a clever piece of casting, Matthew Broderick exchanges his Ferris Bueller persona for the devoted and concerned teacher who is slightly burned out from years of teaching. Add to this the disillusionment of a dull marriage and the shameful dismissal of McAllister’s best friend and colleague, and the esteemed civic teacher’s sense of democracy is put to the test. Brilliant performances, subtle humour and an excellent screenplay (an Oscar nomination for Payne and co-writer Jim Taylor). Surprisingly, this film was a box office sleeper. Based on the novel by Tom Perrotta.

Reese Witherspoon is Tracy Flick, A-Grade student and No. 1 candidate for the student body president. Tracy is confident that her campaign for presidency is going smoothly until Mr McAllister decides to disrupt proceedings and introduce opposition to her as yet unchallenged ride to the top. More than a teenage flick, director Alexander Payne has satirized the popular genre to investigate notions of political and moral corruption. In a clever piece of casting, Matthew Broderick exchanges his Ferris Bueller persona for the devoted and concerned teacher who is slightly burned out from years of teaching. Add to this the disillusionment of a dull marriage and the shameful dismissal of McAllister’s best friend and colleague, and the esteemed civic teacher’s sense of democracy is put to the test. Brilliant performances, subtle humour and an excellent screenplay (an Oscar nomination for Payne and co-writer Jim Taylor). Surprisingly, this film was a box office sleeper. Based on the novel by Tom Perrotta.

results.title: The Hitcher
results.creator_credit: Robert Harmon, Kip Ohman, David Bombyk and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: This dark, violent suspense thriller centres around the strange psychological bond between a travelling serial killer and one of his intended victims. Travelling from Chicago to California, Jim Halsey narrowly escapes an accident when he falls asleep at the wheel. To help stay awake, he picks up hitchhiker, John Ryder, but soon discovers his error when Ryder threatens his life. Although Jim manages to escape, he is soon led on a game of cat-and-mouse across the Texas highways, where Ryder leaves a trail of corpses for Jim to discover. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, C. Thomas Howell, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Jeffrey de Munn.

results.title: Best in show
results.creator_credit: Christopher Guest, Karen Murphy and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Director Christopher Guest and cast members from his previous film ‘Waiting for Guffman’ reunite in this mockumentary following the exploits of five dogs and their handlers before the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. Guest himself plays Harlan Pepper, a fly-fishing store owner and amateur ventriloquist, who decides to enter his beloved bloodhound Hubert in the prestigious competition. His competition includes “Winky”, a Norwich terrier, owned by neurotic couple Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O’Hara) and “Beatrice” a high-strung Wiemaraner owned by preppy couple Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock). Also making the trip to Philadelphia are Scott (John Michael Higgins) and Stefan (Michael McKean), life-partners from New York and their beloved Shih Tzu “Miss Agnes”, and trophy wife Sheri Ann Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge) and her friend and dog trainer, Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) and their poodle, two time ‘Mayflower Best in Show’ winner, “Rhapsody in White”, also known as Butch. Cast also includes Fred Willard, Bob Balaban, Ed Begley Jr and Lewis Arquette.
